newsitem.title: USA: Mass. to announce electric industry restructuring.
newsitem.headline: Mass. to announce electric industry restructuring.

text.p: The Massachusetts Attorney General and New England Electric Systems is to hold a press conference at 1400 EDT/1800 GMT on Thursday to make a major announcement on the restructuring of the electric industry in the state, the Attorney General's office said.

Attorney General Scott Harshbarger will announce a plan to open the retail electric industry to market competition, which will produce billions of dollars in savings for residential and business consumers, his office said in a statement.
Officials from the Attorney General's office and New England Electric declined further comment.
One Wall Street analyst said New England Electric may announce that it will cut electric rates by 10 percent in exchange for recovery of stranded assets under the restructuring.
Another believes the Massachusetts restructuring will result in higher prices in the long term.
"I think they are doing the citizens in Massachusetts a disservice if they allow the electric utility industry to be deregulated," said Gary Hovis, an analyst with Argus Research.
"Instead of prices for electricity going down, if and when deregulation does come on the scene in Massachusetts, I think prices will not go down but will go up, 20 to 25 percent," he said.
